text: hello and welcome to Britt lab in this
episode we're looking at spots what
causes them and how do you treat them
pimples blackheads zits spots acne what
exactly happens to our skin to make
these blemishes erupted our skin
contains millions of tiny glands that
secrete oil when oil builds up our pores
become blocked and can get infected by
the bacteria that naturally live on our
skin we tend to think of acne in spots
as something that just be devil's the
teenage years but they can continue well
into adulthood and cause real distress
and lots of companies around 80% of
those aged 11 to 30 are affected by acne
at some point in adults it affects more
women than men but during teenage years
boys are more susceptible mostly because
of hormone imbalances testosterone seems
to be one of the main culprits in men
and in women it can cause glands to
produce excess oil which clogs up the
pores and feeds skin bacteria which are
already there now skin bacteria may
explain why some people get acne really
badly while others get it hardly at all
everyone's skin carries acne bacteria
but a recent American study suggested
that it comes in good and bad strains
some that cause spots and some that
actually protect your skin so if
researchers can find a way to increase
the body's friendly strains it could be
good news for acne sufferers now spots
and acne are not something I've had to
struggle with for many years but if you
do suffer from them what can you do
squeezing spots can be awfully tempting
but this isn't usually recommended it
can lead to further infection so here's
our brick lab guide surprisingly enough
fatty greasy foods don't seem to make
your acne worse but sugary foods might
so if you've got bad acne you could try
just cutting back on the cakes biscuits
and sweets
some people use toothpaste as it's
rumored to dry out spots
it's not designed for your skin and can
actually irritate acne you may have
heard that manuka honey is an effective
treatment but there aren't enough
studies to back up these claims just yet
one study found that taking 30
milligrams of zinc a day over three
months led to an almost 50% reduction in
spots other tips on reducing man to
makeup you wear wash your hair regularly
and take showers instead of bars as the
cost of flow of water opens the pores
you could also try going full fat on
your dairy u.s. research has recently
found amongst a group of 225 teenagers
those who consumed low-fat dairy and far
more acne than those who stuck to the
full fat options dietary changes and
some supplements may well help you could
go to the chemist and get something over
the counter if that fails then do go and
try your GP as they have access to
prescription only medications which can
be very powerful
why don't you post your comment below
